text-flow.content: Accounts and Subscriptions

target.content: アカウントと登録

text-flow.content: To become a Fedora Translator, you must sign up for accounts and subscriptions as described in this chapter. If you have questions, post them on the fedora-trans-list, or ask for help via Internet Relay Chat, or <acronym>IRC</acronym>, at <systemitem class="fqdomainname">irc.freenode.org</systemitem> on channel <systemitem>#fedora-l10n</systemitem>.

target.content: Fedora の翻訳者になるには、この章に記載されているようにしてアカウントと登録を求めて署名しなければなりません。質問があれば fedora-trans-list にポストするか、<systemitem class="fqdomainname">irc.freenode.org</systemitem> の <systemitem>#fedora-l10n</systemitem> チャネルの Internet Relay Chat いわゆる <acronym>IRC</acronym> 経由で助けを求めてください。

text-flow.content: Subscribing to the Mailing List

target.content: メーリングリストへの登録

text-flow.content: Visit <ulink url="http://listman.redhat.com/mailman/listinfo/fedora-trans-list" /> and subscribe to the main translation mailing list.
Wait for the confirmation email which contains a link to confirm your subscription. Click the link to confirm your subscription.

target.content: あなたの登録を確認するためのリンクを含んだ確認メールが届くのを待ちます。登録を確認するリンクをクリックします。

text-flow.content: Check <ulink url="http://fedoraproject.org/wiki/L10N/Teams" /> to see if there is a special mailing list for your language. If so, subscribe to that list too.
Making a SSH Key

target.content: SSH キーの作成

text-flow.content: If you already have an existing SSH key, you can use it for Fedora work. In that case, proceed to <xref linkend="st-change-permissions" /> in the following procedure. If you do not have a SSH key yet, start with the first step below:
Enter the following command:

target.content: 次のコマンドを入力します:

text-flow.content: Accept the default location (<filename>~/.ssh/id_rsa</filename>) and enter a passphrase.

target.content: デフォルトの場所 (<filename>~/.ssh/id_rsa</filename>) を容認し、 パスフレーズを入力します。

text-flow.content: Remember Your Passphrase

target.content: パスフレーズを覚えておいてください

text-flow.content: You must have your passphrase to commit translations. It cannot be recovered if you forget it.

target.content: 翻訳を送信するにはパスフレーズが必要になります。パスフレーズを忘れてしまうと回復できません。

text-flow.content: Change permissions to your key and <filename>.ssh</filename> directory:

target.content: キーと <filename>.ssh</filename> ディレクトリーのパーミッションを変更します:

text-flow.content: This public key (~/.ssh/id_rsa.pub) will be used for your Fedora account creation described in <xref linkend="sect-Translation_Quick_Start_Guide-Accounts_and_Subscriptions-Applying_for_an_Account" />.
Making a GPG Key

target.content: GPG キーの作成

text-flow.content: Generate a key by typing in a command line:

target.content: コマンドラインに次を入力してキーを作成します:

text-flow.content: A series of prompts guides you through the process. The default values suffice in almost all cases. Remember to choose a good password.

target.content: 処理の間、一連のプロンプトがあなたを導きます。たいていの場合、省略値で十分です。よいパスワードを選択するのを忘れないようにしてください。

text-flow.content: Choosing a Good Password

target.content: よいパスワードの選択

text-flow.content: A good password:

target.content: よいパスワードは:

text-flow.content: consists of uppercase and lowercase letters, numbers, punctuation, and other characters

target.content: 大文字や、小文字、数字、区切り記号、その他の文字からなっている

text-flow.content: does not include any words or names, with or without substitutions

target.content: 置換の有無に関わらず、単語や名前を含んでいない

text-flow.content: is not the same as any other password used for other systems

target.content: 他のシステムで使った他のパスワードと同じではない

text-flow.content: In the resulting text, find your key ID in the statement that resembles 'pub 1024D/1B2AFA1C'. Your key ID is the 8 character 'word' after the slash (<literal>/</literal>). In the previous example, the GPG Key ID is <literal>1B2AFA1C</literal>. Write down your key ID.

target.content: 結果のテキストの中で "pub 1024D/1B2AFA1C" に似た文の中であなたのキー ID を探してください。あなたのキー ID はスラッシュ (<literal>/</literal>) の後の 8 文字の '単語' です。前の例の GPG キー ID は <literal>1B2AFA1C</literal> です。あなたのキー ID を書き留めてください。

text-flow.content: Export your public key to a public server so that others can find it with the following command, substituting your key ID:

target.content: 他の人が見つけられるよう、以下のコマンドであなたの公開キーを公開サーバーに書き出してください。キー ID は置き換えてください:

text-flow.content: This GPG key ID will be used for your Fedora account creation described in <xref linkend="sect-Translation_Quick_Start_Guide-Accounts_and_Subscriptions-Applying_for_an_Account" />.
Applying for an Account

target.content: アカウントの適用

text-flow.content: To sign up for a Fedora account, first visit <ulink url="http://admin.fedoraproject.org/accounts" /> and select <guilabel>New Account</guilabel>.
Fill in <guilabel>Username</guilabel>, <guilabel>Full Name</guilabel> and <guilabel>Email</guilabel>, and click <guibutton>Sign up!</guibutton>. Your password will be emailed to you.

target.content: <guilabel>Username</guilabel> と、<guilabel>Full Name</guilabel>、<guilabel>Email</guilabel> を埋め、<guibutton>Sign up!</guibutton> をクリックします。パスワードがメールされます。

text-flow.content: Go back to <ulink url="http://admin.fedoraproject.org/accounts" /> and log in with your password. The welcome page will be displayed, and it reminds you that CLA is not completed and that an SSH key is not submitted.
To submit public SSH key and GPG key ID, click <guilabel>My Account</guilabel> or go to <ulink url="http://admin.fedoraproject.org/accounts/user/edit" />.

In the Edit Account (user_name) page, enter your GPG key ID in <guilabel>GPG Key ID:</guilabel> field. For the public SSH key, click <guilabel>Browse...</guilabel> button located next to <guilabel>Public SSH Key:</guilabel> field and specify your public SSH key.

target.content: Edit Account (user_name) ページでは、あなたの GPG キー ID を <guilabel>GPG Key ID:</guilabel> 域に入れてください。パブリック SSH キーについては、<guilabel>Public SSH Key:</guilabel> 域の次にある <guilabel>Browse...</guilabel> ボタンをクリックし、あなたのパブリック SSH キーを指定してください。

text-flow.content: <guilabel>Telephone Number</guilabel> and <guilabel>Postal Address</guilabel> fields are also required to fill in for signing the CLA. These information is NOT accessible by others except admin groups. Please refer to Fedora Privacy Policy at <ulink url="http://fedoraproject.org/wiki/Legal/PrivacyPolicy" />.
Other fields will be displayed by any other member by visiting the user's view page.

target.content: 他の領域はユーザーの表示ページを訪れると他のメンバーに表示されます。

text-flow.content: Now click <guilabel>Save!</guilabel> located at the bottom of this page to save your information.

target.content: ではあなたの情報を保存するためにこのページの末尾にある <guilabel>Save!</guilabel> をクリックしてください。

text-flow.content: Signing the CLA

target.content: CLA へのサイン

text-flow.content: You must complete the Contributors License Agreement, or <acronym>CLA</acronym>.

target.content: あなたは貢献者のライセンス同意 <acronym>CLA</acronym> を仕上げなければなりません

text-flow.content: Visit <ulink url="http://admin.fedoraproject.org/accounts" /> and login your account using your user name and password obtained from the previous process.
In the Welcome page, click <guilabel>complete the CLA</guilabel> or go to <ulink url="http://admin.fedoraproject.org/accounts/user/edit" />.

If the information of telephone number and postal address have not been provided yet, the Edit Account (user_name) page will be appeared. Otherwise Fedora Contributor License Agreement page will be displayed. Read through the agreement carefully and click <guibutton>I agree</guibutton> if you are happy to do so.

target.content: 電話番号と郵便番号の情報をまだ提供していなければ、Edit Account (user_name) ページが現れます。そうでなければ Fedora Contributor License Agreement ページが表示されます。同意書をよく読んでいいと思えば <guibutton>I agree</guibutton> をクリックしてください。

text-flow.content: The user-view page is appeared and shows the <guilabel>CLA:</guilabel> field as <guilabel>CLA Done</guilabel>.

target.content: user-view ページが現れ、<guilabel>CLA:</guilabel> 域が <guilabel>CLA Done</guilabel> と表示されます。

text-flow.content: Introducing Yourself

target.content: 自己紹介

text-flow.content: Create a personal page at <ulink url="http://fedoraproject.org/wiki/User:Username" />. This is very useful for Fedora contributors to get to know and contact each other.

Post a short self introduction to the <systemitem>fedora-trans-list</systemitem> mailing list and to the list of your local team with instructions from <ulink url="http://fedoraproject.org/wiki/L10N/SelfIntroduction" />. Please remember to include your FAS user name and your language. With this information, sponsor can identify you for 'cvsl10n' group joining approval.
Joining the <systemitem>cvsl10n</systemitem> Group

target.content: <systemitem>cvsl10n</systemitem> グループへの参加

text-flow.content: In the user-view page, click <guilabel>Apply for a New Group</guilabel> located in the left side bar. If you like to do this step sometime later, your user-view page can be reached at <ulink url="http://admin.fedoraproject.org/accounts/user/view/user_name" />.
Click <guilabel>C</guilabel> of the alphabet, it returns the list of the groups starting with 'c'.

target.content: アルファベットの <guilabel>C</guilabel> をクリックすると、左側のグループが 'c' から始まります。

text-flow.content: Find the group name <guilabel>cvsl10n</guilabel> in the list and click <guilabel>Apply</guilabel>.

target.content: 一覧からグループ名 <guilabel>cvsl10n</guilabel> を探し、<guilabel>Apply</guilabel> をクリックします。

text-flow.content: All sponsors and administrators are notified of your application. Introduce yourself by following <xref linkend="sect-Translation_Quick_Start_Guide-Accounts_and_Subscriptions-Introducing_Yourself" />. Then your language sponsor offers to sponsor you. This may take between an hour and a few days. The membership notification will be emailed to you once sponsored.

The rest of the steps help you test your access and grant you privileges to all the Fedora infrastructure you might need in the near future. Language maintainers and people starting new languages should follow them. Although they are optional for translations, everyone is encouraged to follow them.

target.content: 残りのステップは、アクセスのテストと、近いうちに必要となるかもしれない Fedora の基盤の全てへの権利を与えることです。言語の保守を行う人と新しい言語を始める人はこれに従ってください。翻訳者にとっては任意ですが、できるだけ従うようにしてください。

text-flow.content: Create a Bugzilla account

target.content: Bugzilla アカウントの作成

text-flow.content: Visit <ulink url="http://bugzilla.redhat.com/bugzilla/createaccount.cgi" /> to create a Bugzilla account.
Congratulations

target.content: おめでとうございます

text-flow.content: Sit back and enjoy your achievement. You are now a fully recognized member of the Fedora community, capable of digitally signing documents and emails, submitting contributions, publishing content on the wiki, submitting bugs, following the discussions of our groups and joining other Fedora teams.

target.content: 気楽にあなたの成果を楽しんでください。あなたは Fedora コミュニティーの一員として完全に認識され、デジタル署名されたドキュメントやメールができ、成果を投稿し、wiki にコンテンツを出し、バグを投稿し、我々のグループで議論し、他の Fedora チームに参加できます。

target.content: 気楽にあなたの成果を楽しんでください。あなたは Fedora コミュニティーの一員として完全に認識され、デジタル署名されたドキュメントやメールができ、成果を投稿し、wiki にコンテンツを出し、バグを投稿し、我々のグループで議論し、他の Fedora チームに参加できます。

text-flow.content: Translation Quick Start Guide
Quick start guide to providing translations on the Fedora Project
This guide is a fast, simple, step-by-step set of instructions for translating Fedora Project software and documents.
Contributors
<ulink url="http://fedoraproject.org/wiki/User:Fab">Fabian Affolter</ulink> (translator — German, 2007–2009)
<ulink url="http://fedoraproject.org/wiki/AmanAlam">Amanpreet Singh Alam</ulink> (translator — Punjabi, 2007)
<ulink url="http://fedoraproject.org/wiki/User:Tetonio">Teta Bilianou</ulink> (translator — Greek, 2007)
<ulink url="http://fedoraproject.org/wiki/User:Dapidc">Dapid Candra</ulink> (translator — Indonesian, 2008)
<ulink url="http://fedoraproject.org/wiki/User:Mrtom">Thomas Canniot</ulink> (translator — French, 2006)
Glaucia Cintra (translator — Brazilian Portuguese, 2007–2008)
<ulink url="http://fedoraproject.org/wiki/User:Couf">Bart Couvreur</ulink> (translator — Dutch, 2006–2007)
<ulink url="http://fedoraproject.org/wiki/User:Raven">Piotr Drąg</ulink> (translator — Polish, 2006; editor, 2008)
<ulink url="http://fedoraproject.org/wiki/User:Splinux">Damien Durand</ulink> (translator — French, 2006)
<ulink url="http://fedoraproject.org/wiki/User:Pfrields">Paul W. Frields</ulink> (editor, 2006–2008)
<ulink url="http://fedoraproject.org/wiki/User:Glezos">Dmitris Glezos</ulink> (Translator — Greek, 2006–2007; editor, 2008)
<ulink url="http://fedoraproject.org/wiki/User:Rafaelgomes">Rafael Gomes</ulink> (translator — Brazilian Portuguese, 2008)
<ulink url="http://fedoraproject.org/wiki/User:Ruigo">Rui Gouveia</ulink> (translator — Portuguese, 2009)
Han Guokai (translator — Simplified Chinese, 2008)
Ryuichi Hyugabaru (translator — Japanese, 2007–2008)
<ulink url="http://fedoraproject.org/wiki/ValeriyKruchko">Valeriy Kruchko</ulink> (translator — Russian, 2009)
<ulink url="http://fedoraproject.org/wiki/User:Rlandmann">Rüdiger Landmann</ulink> (editor, 2009)
<ulink url="http://fedoraproject.org/wiki/MagnusLarsson">Magnus Larsson</ulink> (translator — Swedish, 2006)
Gladys Guerrero Lozano (translator — Spanish, 2009)
<ulink url="http://fedoraproject.org/wiki/User:AndrMart">Andrew Martynov</ulink> (translator — Russian, 2006–2007)
<ulink url="http://fedoraproject.org/wiki/User:Noriko">Noriko Mizumoto</ulink> (translator — Japanese, 2006; editor, 2007–2009)
<ulink url="http://fedoraproject.org/wiki/User:Izhar">Mohd Izhar Firdaus Ismail</ulink> (translator — Malay, 2008)
Manuel Ospina (writer, 2006–2007; translator — Spanish, 2006–2007)
Nikola Pajtic (translator — Serbian, 2008)
<ulink url="http://fedoraproject.org/wiki/RobertPereira">Robert Pereira</ulink> (translator — Brazilian Portuguese, 2008)
<ulink url="http://fedoraproject.org/wiki/User:Perplex">Silvio Pierro</ulink> (translator — Italian, 2008)
<ulink url="http://fedoraproject.org/wiki/AlainPortal">Alain Portal</ulink> (translator — French, 2007)
<ulink url="http://fedoraproject.org/wiki/User:Marionline">Mario Santagiuliana</ulink> (translator — Italian, 2009)
<ulink url="http://fedoraproject.org/wiki/User:Jassy">Jaswinder Singh Phulewala</ulink> (translator — Punjabi, 2007)
<ulink url="http://fedoraproject.org/wiki/User:Peti">Sulyok Péter</ulink> (translator — Hungarian, 2009)
<ulink url="http://fedoraproject.org/wiki/User:Tombo">Francesco Tombolini</ulink> (translator — Italian, 2006–2008)
<ulink url="http://fedoraproject.org/wiki/VmlinzQi">Vmlinz Qi</ulink> (translator — Simplified Chinese, 2007)
Thomas Wehrle (translator — German, 2008)
<ulink url="http://fedoraproject.org/wiki/User:Diegobz">Diego Búrigo Zacarão</ulink> (translator — Brazilian Portuguese, 2007–2008; editor, 2007)
Introduction
This guide is a fast, simple, step-by-step set of instructions for translating Fedora Project software and documents.
More information can be found in FAQ, <ulink url="http://fedoraproject.org/wiki/L10N/FAQ" />.
Revision History
Removed deprecated content
Updated links and instructions
Convert document to Publican
Bug #479346 fixed
General bug fixes
Updated Accounts and Subscriptions chapter to conform the current FAS2
Some minor changes made to other chapters along with bugs filed
Replaced the links in the section 3.2
Removed references to i18n.redhat.com (elvis)
Fix GPG key URL
Fix links to Transifex system
Editing for style, grammar, and clarity
Modified and updated all chapters to reflect latest information including usage of Transifex, moved repository etc.
Add information on using an existing SSH key
Brokeup main file into multiple files based on chapters
Add information about LINGUAS and remove unnecessary admonitions
Add information on branch modules and testing changes
Make admonition against manual POT changes
Fix CVS group membership details
Shorten copyright holders list
Generate new POT and PO keeping general entities
Fix erroneous URL (#209900)
Editorial pass, revising procedure to match proper ordering
Additional information about joining the Docs Project and GPG.
Remove step for translating rpm-info since this is now part of document POT
Fix docs translation procedure to include other common files translations
Add information on common entities and admonition for disabled locales
Fix procedural guide and include document-specific entities
Move to DocBook XML 4.4 and use XInclude
Fix spelling (#179717)
Add entity for bug reporting
Fix hostname error
Additional style editing, division of procedures into more readable sections
First round of editing
First draft
Translating Documentation
Some Fedora Documentation Has Moved

Current Fedora Documentation material is now maintained in the Fedora Hosted system as <command>git</command> repositories. This includes the latest versions of the common documentation build tools. You do not need to install <command>git</command> to translate these materials. Instead, use Transifex, as described in previous sections, to translate these documentation materials.
Creating Common Files

If you are creating the first-ever translation for a locale, you must first translate some common files used in all documents for your locale. The common files are located in the Fedora Hosted repository for the <package>fedora-doc-utils</package> package.
Example Locale is <replaceable>pt_BR</replaceable>
The following examples use the locale code <replaceable>pt_BR</replaceable>. Substitute your locale code in these commands as necessary.

Visit Transifex at <ulink url="http://translate.fedoraproject.org" />, and translate the project <guilabel>Docs :: Common entities</guilabel>, using the same procedure shown in <xref linkend="sect-Translation_Quick_Start_Guide-Translating_Software" />.

Visit the <package>fedora-doc-utils</package> hosted project at <ulink url="https://fedorahosted.org/fedora-doc-utils" />. Select the <guilabel>Login</guilabel> link and use your Fedora Account System login and password to login.
Select the <guilabel>New ticket</guilabel> link to file a new ticket. Use the following information to fill in the ticket:
Summary: New language support request: <replaceable>pt_BR</replaceable>
Priority: minor
Component: language support
You may leave the details blank or fill in information as desired.
Attach Files if Necessary
If you have any problems submitting PO files using above instructions, you can attach them to the Trac ticket.
What to Translate
The most important documentation for each release of Fedora are the following:
<guilabel>Docs :: Common entities</guilabel>
<guilabel>Docs :: Release Notes</guilabel>
<guilabel>Docs :: About Fedora</guilabel>
<guilabel>Docs :: Readme</guilabel>
<guilabel>Docs :: Readme Burning ISOs</guilabel>
<guilabel>Docs :: Readme Live Image</guilabel>
Translating Software

The translatable part of a software package is available in one or more <filename class="extension">po</filename> files. These files may be maintained in any of a number of version control systems (VCSs) depending on the project, such as CVS, Subversion, Mercurial, and git. They may be hosted on either <systemitem class="domainname">fedorahosted.org</systemitem> or other systems.

This chapter explains how to translate the projects hosted on <systemitem class="domainname">fedorahosted.org</systemitem>. Translators work on interface to obtaining and committing <filename class="extension">po</filename> files. Before you start, you must first prepare the directories which hold your <filename class="extension">po</filename> files.
File Structure
To find which projects are translatable, visit the project list at <ulink url="http://translate.fedoraproject.org/projects" />.

Before you download any files, prepare the structure holding those files. The described structure below is an example, and your structure can be formed differently. For example, if you want to download the <systemitem>comps</systemitem> project for translation, make the following directories:
To work on another project later, make a directory with the project name under the parent directory such as <filename class="directory">~/myproject/system-config-printer/</filename>.
Obtaining and Translating Projects

Now that you have prepared a directory structure, you can download a file to translate. You may need to communicate with other translators in your language team to avoid conflict. If you are not sure, please contact your language coordinator.

Visit your language page such as <ulink url="http://translate.fedoraproject.org/languages/ja/" />, and select a target release. The interface will redirect you to a page for that release, such as <ulink url="http://translate.fedoraproject.org/languages/ja/collection/fedora/fedora-12/" />.

Scroll down the page to find the table of all projects available for that release. Use the arrow download icon labeled <guibutton>Download ja.po</guibutton> or similar next to each project to download the <filename class="extension">po</filename> file to the directory you created in the previous section. <!-- DO NOT USE COLORS SINCE IT DISADVANTAGES VISUALLY IMPAIRED USERS. USE A LABEL INSTEAD. -->

Since the file name to commit follows the name convention of <filename>lang.po</filename>, change the name of the downloaded file. The following example uses the Japanese locale for the <filename class="extension">po</filename> file:

Now the file is ready for translation. Translate the <filename class="extension">po</filename> file for your language in a <filename class="extension">po</filename> editor such as <application>Lokalize</application> or <application>gtranslator</application>.
Check the integrity of your file before you commit it.
If any error message appears, correct it before commit.
Committing Projects
Once you finish translation work, commit the file using the same interface.

Go back to your language page such as <ulink url="http://translate.fedoraproject.org/languages/ja/" />, and select a target release. The interface will redirect you to a page for that release, such as <ulink url="http://translate.fedoraproject.org/languages/ja/collection/fedora/fedora-12/" />.
Login
At the top of the page, select <guilabel>Sign in</guilabel> to visit the <guilabel>Sign in</guilabel> page. Authenticate with your Fedora Account System user name and password.
Submit

Use the pencil icon labeled <guibutton>Send a translation for this language</guibutton> next to each project, then click the browse button to locate your translated file. <!-- DO NOT USE COLORS SINCE IT DISADVANTAGES VISUALLY IMPAIRED USERS. USE A LABEL INSTEAD. -->
Select the <guibutton>Send</guibutton> to commit your translated file.

Interface displays the message <guilabel>File submitted successfully</guilabel>. If you receive an error or some other success message, please post it to the Fedora Localization Project mailing list so it can be addressed.
Adding New .po File
If there is no <filename class="extension">po</filename> file for your language, add it.
Download the <filename class="extension">pot</filename> file and copy it as your own language's <filename class="extension">po</filename> file.
Once you finish the translation, click on the <guilabel>Add a new translation</guilabel> button at project page.
Type your new file name in the field marked <guilabel>or enter it here:</guilabel>, replacing the file name with your locale:
Proofreading
To proofread your translation as part of the software, follow these steps:
Change directory to the package you want to proofread. For example,
Convert the <filename class="extension">.po</filename> file to a <filename class="extension">.mo</filename> file using <command>msgfmt</command> with <option>-o</option> option:
As a root user, overwrite the existing <filename class="extension">.mo</filename> file in <filename>/usr/share/locale/<replaceable>lang</replaceable>/LC_MESSAGES/</filename>.
First, back up the existing file:
Now move the file converted for proofreading.
Exit root user.
Proofread the package with the translated strings as part of the application:
The application related to the translated package runs with the translated strings.
